creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
inscription: inside L, in pen: [Dear Mr. Robison / Mrs. Frank came to my house some days ago, we talked about my lecture of wood-block in America. She will arranged some lecture and echibition in California / She talled me that you may go to India, and maybe the time that I will be there, you are there. If so, I am very sorry that I could not see you / please sent me the letter about that and when are you going and when / Sincerely yours / Toshi Yoshida]
medium: Woodblock print, ink and colors on paper
signed: bottom L page in pen; date LRC R page: [1952]
title: Greeting Cards to H.E. Robison
